page.title: 15 LIFE ON OSEA
page.content: Like the other farmers we interviewed Mr.Anderson,the farm manager,does not find that life on the island poses any great problems. However some careful planning is necessary if problems are to be avoided. The island is cut off by the tide for 4 hours out of every 12 and therefore arrangements have been made for helicopter evacuation in case of medical emergency. The island's water supply comes from a 400ft. deep well. Electricity and telephone services come via cable from the mainland at Goldhanger.Wood,calor gas and solid fuel are used in cold weather for heating. There is a postal service but no newspapers are delivered. Of the 4 chilren on the island only 1 is of schoolage. She is taken either by boat or by car to Heybridge Primary
